content:
I'm self hosting a server and recently upgraded to 7.0. Last night I got an email with the following error message about the "xkcd bot" which I haven't done anything with, and I don't think any other user has. I guess I can just ignore it, but I thought I let you know:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/12a6b0b3c715a99547489039de2d978c2cc15621/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 55, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/12a6b0b3c715a99547489039de2d978c2cc15621/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 197, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/lib/request.py", line 459, in _wrapped_req_func
    return_value = req_func(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/views/documentation.py", line 322, in integration_doc
    doc_html_str = render_markdown_path(integration.doc, context, integration_doc=True)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/lib/cache.py", line 797, in wrapper
    return user_function(*new_args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/lib/cache.py", line 764, in __call__
    return self.function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/lib/cache.py", line 816, in wrapper
    return user_function(*new_args, **new_kwargs)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/lib/templates.py", line 173, in render_markdown_path
    html = md_engine.convert(markdown_string)
  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/12a6b0b3c715a99547489039de2d978c2cc15621/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/markdown/core.py", line 258, in convert
    newRoot = treeprocessor.run(root)
  File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-06-06-00-46-28/./zerver/lib/markdown/static.py", line 29, in run
    img.set("src", staticfiles_storage.url(url[len("/static/") :]))
  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/12a6b0b3c715a99547489039de2d978c2cc15621/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/django/contrib/staticfiles/storage.py", line 203, in url
    return self._url(self.stored_name, name, force)
  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/12a6b0b3c715a99547489039de2d978c2cc15621/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/django/contrib/staticfiles/storage.py", line 182, in _url
    hashed_name = hashed_name_func(*args)
  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/12a6b0b3c715a99547489039de2d978c2cc15621/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/django/contrib/staticfiles/storage.py", line 513, in stored_name
    raise ValueError(
ValueError: Missing staticfiles manifest entry for 'generated/bots/xkcd/assets/xkcd-help.png'


Deployed code:
- git: None
- ZULIP_VERSION: 7.0


Request info:
- path: /integrations/doc-html/xkcd
- GET: {}
- REMOTE_ADDR: "87.250.224.234"
- QUERY_STRING: ""
- SERVER_NAME: ""
See #issues > http 500 in xkcd bot docs.
@Jonas F: You can safely ignore this. This is #25888 -- it's caused by someone (or some bot) hitting /integrations/docs/xkcd on your server.
